comment: The DOI is implemented in the mapping, however, since the draft JSON is not sent to DataCite using the API (and has a different file name than the actual SPASE record it is based on), it does not have the DOI included within the JSON.
Determined based on record type ("NumericalData" or "DisplayData")
The value is retrieved from the indicated field from the Person record for the personID indicated in spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Contact/spase:personID.
The value is retrieved from the indicated field from the Person record for the personID indicated in spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Contact/spase:personID.
The value is retrieved from the indicated field from the Person record for the personID indicated in spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Contact/spase:personID.

The placement of a person in contributor vs creator is determined by complex logic. If the person is also listed in spase:ResourceHeader/spase:PublicationInfo/spase:Authors, then the person is listed as a creator. If this SPASE field is filled, then the remaining indicated people are listed as contributors except for those with the "User" role. If the SPASE author field is empty, then the Contacts in the SPASE record are listed as creators if they have one of the following roles and in this order: Author, PrincipalInvestigator, MissionPrincipalInvestigator, CoPI, DeputyPI, FormerPI, CoInvestigator. People listed with the same role will be ordered alphabetically by their family name unless a request is sent otherwise. If a SPASE contact with a role mapped to DataCurator or ContactPerson in DataCite is included in the Creator list, that contact should also be mapped to the Contributor list with the appropriate role (e.g. "DataCurator" or "ContactPerson"). All contacts mapped to Contributor with roles of either "DataCurator" or "ContactPerson" should also have their ORCiD included in the mapping for linking to their email address. All other roles excluding "User" and "Publisher" are listed as contributors (see row 23 for details).

Format the names from the indicated field by splitting the name at each "." and then joining the middle initial with the first name separated by a space. The first name and middle initial is piped into the givenName field and the last name is piped into the familyName field.

Format the names from the indicated field by splitting the name at each "." and then joining the middle initial with the first name separated by a space. The first name and middle initial is piped into the givenName field and the last name is piped into the familyName field.

Generally "Personal", but could also be "Organizational". Currently, the script checks the creators extracted from the SPASE record for the following: 1. ", ", ". ", or "_" in the name. 2. Has "givenName" and "familyName" properties populated. If any of those are found, then this value is indeed "Personal". Else, it is "Organizational".

ProjectMember if SPASE role is one of "CoInvestigator", "Contributor", "Developer", "InstrumentScientist", "ProgramScientist", "ProjectEngineer", "ProjectScientist", "Scientist", or "TeamMember" and the person is not listed in spase:ResourceHeader/spase:PublicationInfo/spase:Authors. "DataCurator" if SPASE role is "ArchiveSpecialist". "DataCollector" if SPASE role is "DataProducer". "ContactPerson" if the SPASE role is one of "GeneralContact", "HostContact", "MetadataContact", or "TechnicalContact". "ProjectManager" if the SPASE role is one of "InstrumentLead", "MissionManager", "ProgramManager", "ProjectManager". "ProjectLeader" if the SPASE role is "TeamLeader". Any person not included in the Creator list with a role typically mapped to the Creator list should be included in the contributor list with the "ProjectLeader" role. Contacts with roles of "User" or "Publisher" should not be mapped to the Contributor field. See row 19 for the list of SPASE roles typically mapped to the DataCite Creator list. If a SPASE contact with a role mapped to DataCurator or ContactPerson in DataCite is included in the Creator list, that contact should also be mapped to the Contributor list with the appropriate role (e.g. "DataCurator" or "ContactPerson"). All contacts mapped to Contributor with roles of either "DataCurator" or "ContactPerson" should also have their ORCiD included in the mapping for linking to their email address.

The placement of a person in contributor vs creator is determined by complex logic. If the person is also listed in spase:ResourceHeader/spase:PublicationInfo/spase:Authors, then the person is listed as a creator. If this SPASE field is filled, then the remaining indicated people are listed as contributors except for those with the "User" role. If the SPASE author field is empty, then the Contacts in the SPASE record are listed as creators if they have one of the following roles and in this order: Author, PrincipalInvestigator, MissionPrincipalInvestigator, CoPI, DeputyPI, FormerPI, CoInvestigator. People listed with the same role will be ordered alphabetically by their family name unless a request is sent otherwise. All other roles excluding "User" and "Publisher" are listed as contributors.

When creating a new DOI, the publication year is the current year and is not extracted from SPASE, and is then added to the SPASE record in the PublicationInfo container. When updating an existing DOI's metadata, the information is extracted from SPASE by the following logic. If spase:ResourceHeader/spase:PublicationInfo/spase:PublicationDate is empty, pull the information from the mapping indicated on this row. The logic should pull the earliest ReleaseDate in RevisionHistory/RevisionEvent if there is no entry in the PublicationDate field. If there are also no RevisionHistory entries, then it defaults to the ReleaseDate field.

When creating a new DOI, the publication year is the current year and is not extracted from SPASE, and is then added to the SPASE record in the PublicationInfo container. When updating an existing DOI's metadata, the information is extracted from SPASE by the following logic. If spase:ResourceHeader/spase:PublicationInfo/spase:PublicationDate is empty, pull the information from the mapping indicated on this row. The logic should pull the earliest ReleaseDate in RevisionHistory/RevisionEvent if there is no entry in the PublicationDate field. If there are also no RevisionHistory entries, then it defaults to the ReleaseDate field.

When creating a new DOI, the publication year is the current year and is not extracted from SPASE, and is then added to the SPASE record in the PublicationInfo container. When updating an existing DOI's metadata, the information is extracted from SPASE by the following logic. If spase:ResourceHeader/spase:PublicationInfo/spase:PublicationDate is empty, pull the information from the mapping indicated on this row. The logic should pull the earliest ReleaseDate in RevisionHistory/RevisionEvent if there is no entry in the PublicationDate field. If there are also no RevisionHistory entries, then it defaults to the ReleaseDate field.
The ResourceID is also extracted and mapped into the identifier object. Converted to a URL by removing "spase:/" and adding "https://hpde.io"
The ResourceID is also extracted and mapped into the identifier object. No conversions for this field
Determined manually per SPASE repository, usually English. "en"

If the value of spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Association/spase:AssociationType = PartOf, the DOI of the related item is extracted from the SPASE record indicated in the spase:Association/spase:AssociationID field.

If the value of spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Association/spase:AssociationType = PartOf AND no DOI for the item is found, the spase:ResourceID value is converted to a URL by removing "spase:/" and adding "https://hpde.io".
The spdx URL of the license, e.g. "https://spdx.org/licenses/CC0-1.0.html".
The title of the indicated license as indicated by SPDX, e.g. "Creative Commons Zero v1.0 Universal".
The identifier of the spdx license, e.g. "CC0-1.0".
SPDX if the license is from SPDX.
https://spdx.org/licenses/ if the license if from SPDX.
Words are separated by a space in the logic.

If the value of spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Association/spase:AssociationType = Other, the DOI of the related item is extracted from the SPASE record indicated in the spase:Association/spase:AssociationID field.

If the value of spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Association/spase:AssociationType = Other AND no DOI for the item is found, the spase:ResourceID value is converted to a URL by removing "spase:/" and adding "https://hpde.io".
no titleType for the item's title.

If the value of spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Association/spase:AssociationType = ["DerivedFrom" or "ChildEventOf"], the DOI of the related item is extracted from the SPASE record indicated in the spase:Association/spase:AssociationID field.

If the value of spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Association/spase:AssociationType = ["DerivedFrom" or "ChildEventOf"] AND no DOI for the item is found, the spase:ResourceID value is converted to a URL by removing "spase:/" and adding "https://hpde.io".
Converted to a URL by removing "spase:/" and adding "https://hpde.io".

If the value of spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Association/spase:AssociationType = RevisionOf, the DOI of the related item is extracted from the SPASE record indicated in the spase:Association/spase:AssociationID field.

If the value of spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Association/spase:AssociationType = RevisionOf AND no DOI for the item is found, the spase:ResourceID value is converted to a URL by removing "spase:/" and adding "https://hpde.io".

If the PublishedBy field is not populated (previous row), then the spase record for the personID indicated in spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Contact/spase:PersonID with spase:ResourceHeader/spase:Contact/spase:Role = Publisher is used to retrieve the organization name.
DO NOT convert to a URL since that URL will not work.
converted from string to URL by adding https://hpde.io as the prefix.
Start and end dates are combined into this schema.org field. If no StopDate found or a relativeStopDate is found, append '/..' to end.
Start and end dates are combined into this schema.org field. If no end date found, "/.." is appended at the end of the date.
